Pre-Game Insights: Ghana has not won in this qualifying campaign and is third in Group F with just one point.
Sudan is second in Group F with three points after their recent defeat against Angola.
Ghana is unbeaten at home against Sudan, having recorded four wins and a draw in five such games.
James Kwesi Appiah's side will be looking to improve upon their goalless draw against Ghana in 2010.
Sudan had won two straight matches on the road before their defeat against Angola.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Alidu Seidu gave Ghana the lead just before half-time in their previous match against Niger.
Oumar Sako equalized for Niger in the 81st minute in the same match.
Khidir and Mustafa Mohamed scored for Sudan in their match against Angola.
Otto Addo's side are unbeaten at home against Sudan, recording four wins and a draw in five such games.
